Class w3c.amaya.applets.ActionTest 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----w3c.thotlib.SampleAction
           |
           +----w3c.amaya.applets.ActionTest
public class ActionTest
extends SampleAction
This is an Applet for Amaya demonstrating how action can be registered from Java and how they can override the default behaviour.

This applet override the standard selection mecanism, selecting all the block when clicking on a text element.

It registers an Action "NewAmayaClick" and associate it as the default behaviour on selection events.

Most of the callbacks do nothing except callbackElement which handle the selection on an element.

callbackElement 
 public int callbackElement(int document,
                            int view,
                            long element,
                            long sschema,
                            int type,
                            int position)
Callback when a Element type event occurs.

Parameters:
event - the event type TteXXX as defined in w3c.thotlib.APIAppAction
document - the document number in which the event occured
view - the view number in which the event occured
element - the element generating the event
sschema - the Structure Schema of this element
type - the element type
position - extra information for Delete event.
Returns:
zero if the action handled the event, non-zero if the default handling should take place.
